review: This game was tickling my gamer developer vibes. The vibes exist even though I have never developed a game before. To add to this... Because I've never created a game before, this taught that it is very difficult to do so, which means that this game touches on realism beyond any other game developer tycoon. I'm a lover for realistic games, and this takes the cake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125706789', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1700150359}
review:
I loved Game Dev Tycoon when I was younger, and I was super excited for a new Game Tycoon that was .5 better.

I'm sure the actual game is great, if you can understand how it works. The voice acting was my favorite part by far, especially when there would be 3 characters talking at once.

If you love fun, you'll love this game. 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049256681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1691548599}
review:
Game Tycoon 1.5, is an unmitigated disaster. Its convoluted gameplay, dated graphics, and lack of depth make for an excruciating experience. The attempt at realism is laughable, and innovation is practically non-existent. This game is an insult to the simulation genre and a prime example of what not to do. Avoid at all costs.

This review was brought to you by ChatGPT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1684567094}
review:
Game Tycoon 1.5 is a very poorly made business/tycoon/spreadsheet simulator where, just like the Game Dev Tycoon game the developer set out to rip off, you run a game dev studio, put together some generic stuff about a "game" you are going to make, then click through the various dialogues and panels until it gets done and the numbers on the panel change a bit.  It's not as exciting as hospital tycoon games or city builders, even if it was developed well, it wouldn't be that interesting.  But the technical implementation here is garbage, even for a game from 2016.

Apart from just looking bad and being clunky, it's riddled with bugs and inconveniences.  This really does look and feel like a bargain bin game from the 1990s. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game interface is mostly just text boxes/dialogs and where there are graphical elements, they look like rejects from 1998.  While that might be fine for the 1990s, gaming has evolved a lot since then... it's 2023, and that kind of thing just won't fly anymore, it's just not visually up to scratch.

The game only displays in 4:3 stretched aspect ratio.  It's possible they developed this using an old CRT they found in a dumpster, or this game has been specifically designed for people gaming on PC's from 1995... either way, this isn't really acceptable in the modern era of PC gaming.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the video game construction kit/toolset, the 3D GameStudio from Conitec Datasystems.  In their own words, this system is so dumbed down you can "click together 3D games from pre-assembled game templates" in a matter of hours.  This is a very poor quality toolset sometimes used by amateur/unskilled developers as it doesn't require advanced game development skills, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities.  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Game Tycoon 1.5 is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079439123', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1675608090}
review: Game Tycoon 1.5 is a game development simulation game that fails to live up to its potential. The graphics are outdated and unappealing, with clunky menus and interface elements that make it difficult to navigate the game. The gameplay mechanics are shallow and repetitive, with limited options for creating and managing your own game development studio. The AI is also lacking, with AI-controlled competitors that do not respond realistically to player actions. The game also lacks meaningful progression, with limited opportunities for growth and expansion as your studio develops new games. The game's community is small and inactive, making it difficult to find help or support when you need it. Overall, Game Tycoon 1.5 is a disappointment, offering players a limited and unsatisfying gaming experience. Unless you are a die-hard fan of game development simulation games, it is best to pass on this title and look for a more polished and engaging gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048995735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1645645043}
review:
DO. NOT. BUY. This advice comes from a game developer that couldn't finish this game's tutorial. Even if you get this game for free, don't waste your time with it.

- The tutorial narrator keeps talking and showing his avatar every couple seconds, making it impossible to see what's behind him and making the game super annoying.
- The tutorial tells you to go to a place X and click on thing Y. However, you can't tell what that thing is, neither where it's located.
- The tutorial actions are too generic, so you can't know what you need to do. How am I supposed to know that "Now, you can speed up the time a bitâ€¦" means that I need to click on a poorly designed bar in the bottom of the screen with a snail icon? Why not say "Now, you can speed up the time a bit by clicking in the bar located in the bottom of your screen". How about "Go to your office"? There is nothing showing you that this specific building is your project office, which is separated from the first building you're guided to, which is also your office, but of another kind.
- The tutorial voice overlaps with other voices in the game, making both impossible to understand, and are unskippable.
- If you click on something before finishing the first, you flicker the screen on the first action and then proceed to the second one.  

0/10, hiding this game from my steam library so I can't accidentaly click on it again in the future. (the 4 hours I have played are only from idling to get cards)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028021509', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1645240712}
review:
So I remember playing this game many, many years ago. I still have the box and the CD for the game somewhere around the house too. Perhaps nostalgia for old games i played when i was younger made me give this game a shot again, with me forgetting the jank-ness of the game, as well as how repetitive and boring it is.

Let me just take a quick second to point something out, this game came out before game dev tycoon and game dev story. This was a game from around 2007, did this game get put on steam to cash in on the success of those games? Probably. But I wanted to just clear up the misconception that people thought this was a quick game made to appeal to people enjoying the genre at the time, this is an older game then them. Still though, this game is definitely bad.

Lets begin with how you can play the game. You can play an endless mode, which has no real challenge other then not going bankrupt, and a campaign mode which lets you 'attempt' to follow a tutorial, and a few mission games, such as making a game of specific quality or earning x amount of money. From there, you can select your company logo, pick from one of three characters and name your company. After which, the game begins.

There are four 'sections' you can go in the game. The first is the office area, which has a bank, your office and your development office. The second section is the university, where you can hire programmers, artists or composers, as well as buy news article information on current game trends as well as how you and your companies currently published games came out like. The third section is the industrial park section. This section has the marketing firm area, where you can advertise your company to improve the likelihood of your games selling better, the licensing office, where you can rent a game engine for a single game development use, take on distribution deals, and, at the first of every month, participate in auctions to acquire licenses to create game tie ins. Next is the publishing house, where you can put your game and the contents of it, such as a manual or t shirt together, print out the amount of copies you want of the game, and then set up the distribution. Lastly in this section is the game store which simply shows how current games are selling. The final section is a 'home' section. Where you can add some items in your house. There is no other reason to this section.

The whole game revolves around these four sections and the game can boil down to a very simple and repeated pattern. Get money from the bank, hire some employees, pick up a game engine, find a distributor you think you can work with their demands of quality, genre and time frame. Construct the game concept, tell your employees to develop the game. Go to the printing house, set up how you want your game to be bundled, print copies, get the distributor to distribute the game, wait a month to see how sales went. Rinse, repeat ad nauseum. Thats it. Now, you may be saying that isnt necessarily bad, just boring. But it gets much much worse.

You see, the game is buggy. Very, very buggy. You can bug out dialogues in the game by clicking dialogue options multiple times, which can be annoying to try and get out of dialogues, to absolutely game breaking. You can sell so much of your stock that doesn't exist, that you break the integer limit and give yourself infinite money. But thats not all, the game is very unstable. This game will crash, like once every ten minutes. As I mentioned, this was a game from around 13 years ago, and its clear that the jank which existed when the game originally came out, only got worse with time, as there was no effort to clean up the bugs or make the game run any better. Your games will crash and there is no auto save. Saving can also crash your game, or make your game restart. 

Ultimately, this game is even worse then i remember it and, frankly should not be on steam. It is clearly broken, and has been long abandoned by the original creators. A simple cash grab at the time, now destined to get the occasional dollar or two from hopeful individuals looking for a different taste at the business sim genre. Please avoid.

P.S One last thing, the game seems to take inspiration, at least in my opinion, from airline tycoon. The whole idea of playing as a character, in a cartoonesque environment dealing with cartoonesque people through dialogue in a more 'direct management' style of play. Airline Tycoon is a great game, and if you want to see what im talking about where you can see the inspiration of the game style comes from, take a look at that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101077321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1627448960}
review:
" Maman, tu peux m'acheter Game Dev Tycoon ? "

" Mais voyons, mon fils... Tu sais que nous sommes pauvres, mais va voir dans la cuisine, j'ai une surprise pour toi"

"Constate qu'un jeu sous le nom de Game Tycoon 1.5 est sur la table"

Game Tycoon est mauvais, soyons honnÃªtes, le jeu est en 4:3, les paramÃ¨tres sont inexistants, les musiques sonnent comme une Ã©poque rÃ©volue et la direction artistique transpire les annÃ©es 90/2000 en plus des moult bugs faisant parfois crasher l'ordinateur.

Du coup, deux questions me sont venus en tÃªte : le jeu est-il rÃ©ellement sorti en 2014 ou est-ce simplement un troll de la part des crÃ©ateurs de sortir un jeu aussi exÃ©crable ?  

Je me suis donc penchÃ© sur mon premier questionnement et pour moi c'Ã©tait une Ã©vidence, Game Tycoon est bien plus vieux que Ã§a et c'est en fouillant la chaÃ®ne YouTube du studio Sunlight Games que j'ai constatÃ© que le projet de base venait du studio "Enjoy Entertainment" qui avait dÃ©jÃ  sorti le jeu en 2003, ce qui est beaucoup plus logique.
En Bref, Sunlight Games a rÃ©cupÃ©rer les droits de cette licence tout comme ils l'ont fait avec Gold Rush! apparu Ã  la base sur amiga en 1988.

Mais est-ce que Ã§a pardonne les dÃ©fauts ? Ã‰videmment que non ! A cette Ã©poque d'excellents jeux de gestions aux budgets moindres proposaient quelque chose de convenable et qui sont encore jouables de nos jours.
Est-ce l'ancÃªtre de Game Dev Tycoon ce qui fait que Game Tycoon proposait un genre novateur ? Toujours pas. Game Dev Story est sorti en 1997 et il est sans aucun doute Ã  des annÃ©es lumiÃ¨res au niveau de l'optimisation, de la direction artisitique et de la bande sonore.

Ajoutons que la version 1.5 n'a rien amÃ©liorer. Quid du second volet ? Les avis sont unanimes sur le fait que c'est mauvais Ã  cause des mÃªmes problÃ¨mes que le premier volet.

Donc il est Ã©vident que la sÃ©rie " Game Tycoon " ( Et je parle bien de Game Tycoon et non de Game DEV Tycoon qui lui est trÃ¨s bon ) est Ã  Ã©viter bien que l'adaptation "Idle" sur smartphone a l'air d'Ãªtre convenable, mais je dÃ©teste Ãªtre mÃ©chant et je suis donc allÃ© voir de plus prÃªt les autres productions de Sunlight Games, car concevoir un jeu est une tÃ¢che complexe, parfois coÃ»teuse et que Ã§a ma fait mal au coeur de voir que leurs derniÃ¨res sorties sont si peu populaires, alors que les jeux ont l'air d'Ãªtre Ã  des annÃ©es lumiÃ¨res de la sÃ©rie Game Tycoon.

Par exemple, Gangsters 1920 a l'air d'Ãªtre plutÃ´t sympa et sur quelques aspects original en dÃ©pit d'une pÃ¢te graphique ou on a l'impression qu'il manque quelque chose : https://store.steampowered.com/app/1163490/Gangsters_1920/?curator_clanid=33033027

Construction Playground doit probablement faire le cafÃ© pour un simulateur allemand, un jeu gÃ©nÃ©rique, certes, mais on voit que le studio peut faire des jeux autre que des productions Ã  l'optimisation douteuse et Ã  la DA horrible : https://store.steampowered.com/app/1451420/Construction_Playground/?curator_clanid=33033027

One Hundred Ways la DA est pas mauvais en vrai : https://store.steampowered.com/app/404630/One_Hundred_Ways/?curator_clanid=33033027

author: {'steamid': '76561198117837119', 'num_games_owned': 3901, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1592888099}
review:
Game Tycoon 1.5 is a simulator game where you play as a game developer trying to make your games and become a video game tycoon. Game Tycoon 1.5 has been noted by quite a few places to be one of the worst games out there and that is certainly the case.

I gave this game a shot a few times, but I just lost interest out of it being bland as well as it being frustrating to play. Maybe I'm bad at following directions, but some of the tasks that it has you do to set up your own game aren't exactly clear and leaves you wondering if you'd missed a step. I eventually got to getting my game being published, but I don't believe I ever got it published because for whatever reason it wouldn't work or maybe I did get it to work one time, but I can't exactly remember and don't bother to. I see that there's a manual, but you'd think that if the game is going to teach it to you anyway, you'd be able to manage, but that doesn't always seem to be the case.

The visuals look goofy and the music is just filler that's just trying to fit the atmosphere of the areas you visit in the game.

Whatever you do, please stay away from this atrocity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964153663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1429549325}
review:
An absolutely terrible attempt at copying the success of the much, much better Game Dev Tycoon. The 1.5 in the name even seems to have managed to fool many people into thinking that the two games are somehow related. Trust me, they are not.

The premise of the game is simple, make games, research new "tech" for games, hire staff, make better games. Unfortunately none of this actually works as it should and from the get go you are shown just how foolish you were for purchasing this game.

The tutorial is buggy, the game play is extremely counterintuitive, the music is repetitive and the voice acting is horrible. Large parts of the game feel unfinished and there are even parts that are still untranslated from the original German.

This is a waste of money and a game that seeks to sell copies purely on it's imagined association with Game Dev Tycoon. Definitely one to avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1562040894}
review:
[h1] Game Summary: [/h1] 
It's a very niche concept, but there are a few games out there centered around the idea of playing as a game developing company.  Many times these games start the player back in the 80's, to recreate the gaming industry from its inception to the present day.  The objective is to lead a team of game developers in designing an engine and producing various game series that sell well and keep the company in the black.  It doesn't sound very invigorating, a game based around work, and dipping deep into meta territory at that, but when pulled off right, they are well received.  This game doesn't do things right though, and is widely panned for it.  


[h1] Pros: [/h1] 
	â€¢ The graphics are colorful and tolerable.
	â€¢ There are some voice-acted lines.  
	â€¢ The music is upbeat.  	


[h1] Cons: [/h1] 
	â€¢ The game design isn't clear as to what certain features are supposed to represent or mean.  Even which office is yours isn't immediately obvious.  When the game refers to a file cabinet or the project, I don't see anything that quite fits that description, so I'm not positive to what they're referring.  
	â€¢ The game seemingly expects you to know how running a business should work already, as it expected you to take out a loan from the bank, with no details or explanation on how much of an interest rate there'd be on the loan, how often you'd have to make payments, and so forth.  
	â€¢ When trying to create a game engine, I didn't know what features were necessary or what impact selecting or not selecting various options would have on the development process.  Would it make the product better but take longer, was there more chance for bugs?  
	â€¢ The reward for successfully running the business didn't matter or motivate me.  Why do I care if my avatar can buy a fancy car or furniture?  Unless it grants some benefit, it's mere fluff.  
	â€¢ The game feels too much like actual work and is boring.  


[h1] Conclusion: [/h1] 
This game seemed to emphasize and focus too much on the wrong aspects of game development and running a company that people simply don't care about.  Having players walk around various areas, such as to the bank to apply for a loan, or over to a university to seek out employees, starts going too far into recreating the feeling of doing this in real-life.  Being realistic can be something to strive for in a game, but not when it's simulating office work.  I don't feel like someone working in a gaming company and doing a labor of love.  I feel like I'm heading into the office, taking care of errands along the way, before shuffling through a file cabinet and completing paperwork.  The tasks of acquiring capital and employees could have been done from the company and in a quick and painless manner, so I could get into the core gameplay instead.  I got confused as to how to complete objectives in the game, and was bored before I even got a game started, so I can't recommend this meta experience to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6824, 'num_reviews': 1311, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1562868182}
review:
To play Game Tycoon 1.5 on modern systems you need to add exception on this game's .exe file in DEP...

... but still, I'm not sure if it's worth the trouble. This is one of the lowest quality management/economy games I ever played. Everything in this game is ugly, confusing, and really buggy. Sometimes you can't even tell if it's working properly or the game just froze. It feels like a really cheap copy of some other "Game Tycoon" game. So yeah, don't bother with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201855922', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1576974955}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990453351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 977, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1562172343}
review:
"The year is 1982" and it plays like it. 
I'm exaggerating of course, but even for the 2003's standards (which is when the original version came out. That 2014 release date is just a plain lie, even not counting the original, the 1.5 was released in 2006,) this game is just archaic, on top of being terribly designed, with awful interface that resembles more of a hidden object game rather than a management simulation. Back in the day, there were more Tycoon games that made interfaces in such way, but they were usually better designed, accessible and comprehensible. 
Even if you would leave aside the design and aesthetic aspects, this game is still a sloppy work. It's riddled with bugs, crashes constantly and while it was already fixed, they have released this game without its .exe file. 
Removing their names and leaving the blank page in the credits is probably the smartest thing they have done in regards to this whole mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045626344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1397165188}
review:
Few things makes me want to go back in time.

Knowing that I could get a refund if I tried it within 30 days of buying this game is one of these rare moments.

The art it's terrible, the gameplay it's everything but not fun.

I was really dumb to think this was Game Dev Tycoon 1.5. It sounds like the "1.5" it's there to make you think that, and ignore the of the dev word. This is the worst tycoon game I've played in my entire life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5549, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1533462361}
review:
Creating a game can be fun, creating a game within a game less so, especially if it's poorly made like Game Tycoon 1.5.

This game has it all (or not) from poor voice acting, bad graphics to boring gameplay and bugs. Not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2216, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1533156373}
review:
a Broken game that was never finished which should of never been released, and from the looks of it no effort was invested to polish, fix or patch the game to make it any better.

Sure if you look past all the ugly and unfinished work the game itself is quite fun, and for a tycoon game you can get some enjoyment out of, there are much worse out there, but the way the game is, the way it looks an plays is just too much of a negative aspect to promote or recommend this game, especially since the developers never even bothered with the game, so if they didn't bother to make it decent why should we bother to buy it?

The price t sells for isn't that high, but you can get it for half of that when it goes on sale, if you get lucky even less when you find it in a bundle online somewhere, as a game collector it's a +1 for, you it has cards , no achievements and is playable but don't expect anything decent from it.

review: Booted this up for the first time today. So.. The game is slower than a game of chess and The tutioral stops after reaching 'the bank' which is like first step in everything. So.. yeah the game is also just broken and unplayable in its current state

review: Este es un juego con una gran idea pero muy mal llevado a cabo. EL juego es muy poco intuitivo y para aprender a hacer las cosas hay que dar 50 vueltas. ademÃ¡s estÃ¡lleno de bugs que pueden crashear el juego o que te piden aue hagas algo que ya estas haciendo (vÃ©ase porejemplo, el hecho de tener que cerrar la ventana de proyecto y volver a abrirla para que te coja el nombre, porque si no no lo hace) El tutorial estÃ¡ en modo audio (en inglÃ©s) y casi no se oye, lo que hace dificil el saber que hacer. AdemÃ¡s en ocasiones te dice que hagas cosas pero no te explica como hacerlas. DespuÃ©s de esto el hacer segun que tienes que cambiar de oficina o sala cuando deberÃ­as poder hacerlo en le mismo sitio, por lo que se hace tedioso tener que crear un proyecto y luego irte a otro lado a que trabajen en el para luevo volver a coger el motor acabado y tener que vlver a la otra oficina a diseÃ±ar el juego  y volver a la anterior para que trabajen sobre el juego... etc etc. Es un juego que mata la diversiÃ³n con ciertas cosas que entorpecen la jugabilidad. Si hibiera subtitulos en las cosas y las ayudas estuvieran subtituladas se harÃ­a mÃ¡s jugable. Por ahora la verdad es que no recomiendo este juego en absoluto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1508949950}
review:
[h1]Crash Gordon...[/h1]

Well, ever had the urgent feeling of getting something done, that is really painful or annoying? No, then you never have even lived... and obviously this game also never had a real life - given the bad reviews. But are those reviews justified? Or are they just the entitled, dying screams of young and unknowledgable kids?

Actually I have to say, yes - those bad reviews are justified. The game crashes more often than you can actually achieve something in this game. Yes, this pretty much ruins the fun for a lot of people. Maybe it is because you have a too powerful machine on your side, or maybe it's just that the devs really have trouble with troubleshooting and debugging a game... Who knows.

However, to put the blame on the players - as it is often done by devs in recent years  is no good excuse for their own failures.

I won't put up a fancy table for this game, since I couldn't play one decent session without the game crashing again, and yet another time again - lucky that it doesn't really deep crash the system, so the taskmanager actually is your friend.

[h1]Not Recommended[/h1]

Rating: 0/10

Because of the bad debugging and quality control this isn't a game anymore but just a veritable crash-fest. Aside of that the game could be fun - if it would work properly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162940282', 'num_games_owned': 4051, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1503521452}
review:
I finished the game campaing just now, but oh god, what a pain!!!
Game is barely playable, at least on Windows 10 I needed to enable Windows XP compatibility and even with that, game would crash from time to time during gameplay. So I did a lot of unnecessary savings because you never know. Also, game performance would decrease almost exponentially over little time (save and load would solve this for another one hour or so). 
The in game english, even google translator could do better (Marry Xmas for the devs to!!!) and next time just use the same string for the type of game and licenses because sometimes  they are different and you can only match them by trial and error.  
Nevertheless, I liked the concept of the game, somewhat the strategy and micromanagement aspect of it.
But I can't recommend this to anyone, let's just hope devs had learnt with their mistakes and improved the sequel because i'm going there now :X
Oh and in the end cutscene you just receive a phallic award, as if the game is giving me the middle finger because he just don't even care how bad he is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273592', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1561726607}
review:
Summary: I have long enjoyed these kinds of games, but they aren't for everyone.  There are more popular, accessible and recent games in this genre that you would probably enjoy more.

-----

In the late 90's/early 2000s, there were some not-too-well-know games based around the entertainment industry.  Games like Hollywood Mogul, Chartwars, Bestseller, and Gamebiz: The Magical Years were not visually-driven games, instead were mostly text and menu-based games.  Game Tycoon shares a lot of similarities with Gamebiz, with a notable difference - it tries to add a visual aspect to the game.  

The biggest problem with the game is how unclear the steps are.  This is typical of this genre of game, and it doesn't take too much to figure out, although I see a lot of complaints about it.  There are some areas where the interface has issues, for instance, if you click on the publisher shelf, you are stuck with the contract.  There are some things, such as the game store, which are pretty much useless and should have been utilized more.  

So don't go into this game expecting too much.  It is basically database management with an incomplete facelift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032089697', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1499480326}
review:
Tycoon games, they are slowly making a comeback, they were all the rage in the late 90â€™s early 2000â€™s. Trying to cash-in on the success of the SIMS franchise, the tycoon phenomenon churned out everything from Roller coasters to Hospitals and everything in between, some hitting the spot (Roller-coaster Tycoon series) and some flopped like a dead fish (TV Tycoon any-one?). Unlike the SIM games which was wholly developed by Maxis and EA, anything labelled Tycoon was a developers free for all.

One of these Tycoon style games is Gamer Tycoon which comes from Sunlight Games (Originally released under Beat Games 2006). So you think you can make a radical game engine, that can make Frostbite Look like a snow puddle? Can you hit the shelves with a AAA Shooter that makes BF1 look like a Boy Scout Jamboree Simulator? Then crack your Knuckles and start Cobol your fingers silly, you dweeb!

ON THE MENU
Up front the game menu is simply yet pleasing with Champaign (Tutorial + set quests) and Endless (Sandbox) modes, three set characters to choose from (1 fm, 2 m) each with their own set of skills, Company name, choice of 8 company logos (you can edit/add your own outside of the game) three levels of difficulty, Sound and Music sliders and finally the mandatory Save, Load and Exit buttons. Sadly no video options which this game dose need, badly and no option for entering at any time period, you start smack bang in 1982 (thank god flared pants were on rapid decline by then!).

GAME PLAY
You choose your CEO Lydia, Kevin or Simon; logo, company name (Electronic A**holes) and choose champaign or endless. 

Let me stop you right here for a moment, I insist you read the manual on Steam and play the tutorial first before you do Endless, as the game is not, I repeat, it is not user friendly. Okay, continue.

You start in the office suburb, race off to the bank and grovel like Oliver Twist for a bit-o-dosh, race over to either the Licensing Broker (at the Media Park) and buy a one-off, off-the-shelf game engine or to your office and set out a plan to build your own reusable engine. 

You get a few options for what you want in your engine in regards to graphics, sound and how it is played but this list will grow and shrink as time and new technology comes into play. Then your off to the University suburb to find the best Self Flagellating, Art Deco, Emo Elmo money shouldnâ€™t buy (offer them a nose ring and black eye shadow, and their yours for pittance). Back to the office suburb and into the employees building. A note, exiting any menu, building or Map is via rmb.

Here you assign the project (in this case the engine) and assign your programmer to emoji the crap out of it through x amount of de-caf till said engine is done. Then off to the Media Park and to the Licensing Broker to pick a gaming license that appeals to you, whether it be a RPG or sports game or a Platform adventure, you will only have a certain time and/or a certain quality rating your game must be, so pick wisely because this will come back and bite you in the bum, big time.

Now back to your office and build the plan for the game you want to make, again there are only a few options to start with but it will expand as you progress. Pick the machine you want it player on and what languages you want to translate to. Once the plan is done, race over to your employee building and watch your sole programmer become a pile of gibbering mess. Back to the Uni and hire more mindless Art Students (hope that that four eyed prick, Gates is not one of them).

Back to the office and assign them all. Wait for the coffee to run out and the programmers to finish. Grab the 8-bit tape (yes, a tape! Thatâ€™s how most games started, thank Jobs we skipped the punch cards!).

Back to the Media park and to the Printing Company, pick what goodies you want to pack with the tape (a manual would be too kind to the un-washed), pick your print run, slap on the license you got earlier, set a price and sit back and wait for the money start rolling inâ€¦...In your dreams DWEEB!

IT WAS GOING SO WELL, THEN I OPENED THE BOX.
I made the above sound so good, well guess what, itâ€™s not! Instead of making a great game, which this had so much going for it, Sunlight (Beat Games) created a Nightmare on Android Street. The tutorial is vague and hard to hear over sound effects (there is no caption text). None of the buildings are labelled so you have to guess which building is your office and which is the Printers!

If you accidentally click on the wrong license or if you do not read the fine print on the license contract, you can not undo it, you are stuck with it, suck eggs and die. Make a minor mistake of any kind and it is all over, red rover, even on easy and sandbox! This game is not forgiving in any way shape or form, it is out to make you rage-quit at the first chance it gets.

All menus and areas you exit via the RMB, except the Advertising office, if you RMB you crash the game, you must click â€œByeâ€! Why the !FORTRAN! did some DinkC decide to NOT make this menu RMB to exit!!!! The game is glitched and has more bugs that a termite infestation.

IN THE END
If you can survive the harsh reality that Game Tycoon was hated from birth by its developers, not smash you PC against a wall, you might find a minuscule of decent game play here, believe me, it is there but can you take the punishment Sunlight Games dished out on this Tycoon game. Like Steve, this is dead, just bury it deep inside your drive, like Bill did with DOS in Windows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060262647', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1605385174}
review:
Intro:

Sunlight Games is an indie studio located in Cologne Germany. I would understand if you didnâ€™t know about this little studio.  Their record of accomplishment is at best underwhelming and at worst, utter garbage.  You can check out their portfolio here.  There have been some successes, Gold Rush! Classic for example has a very positive 8 out of 10 on steam (according to 43 reviews).  Others however have received mixed reviews, such as Gold Rush! Anniversary and One Hundred Ways. 
The Game Tycoon series seems to be something of a cursed series.  Both being especially ill received for very similar problems; like the bugs, the translation errors (and oversights). Not to mention the boring gameplay.  You might remember the last time that I claimed it kept breaking in five minutes,  a fact that I still stand by as it happened multiple times.  However,  I did get a little further this time.  Not too far, mind you, because of the obtuse design and just running out of ideas. 

The time spent until breakage:

From moment one the problems mount up.  For a couple of days, I could not even get into the game, the resolution was messed up that I could not load it. It would arbitrarily start working again one day with no influence or change outside.  There is no options menu- like anywhere.  A gross oversight that becomes even more egregious when you realize that you are stuck with the game's bipolar whims.  When you try to select a campaign the game closes then reopens,  this time the music has vanished.   Half the tools donâ€™t work for some reason,  like the character select screen,  which remains blank no matter how many times I tried to interact with it. 

There is something very unsettling about sound design and visuals. The bizarre silences between instructions, lack of music, and static imagery were unsettling to say the least.  It was a dream that could not decide if it wanted to become a nightmare, the jarring mundanity of boring game design and horrific existential horror of a plastic world where nothing is real except you. .  Do not get the wrong impression; Game Tycoon 1.5 is a very cheap and rushed project due to the abundance of selling/translation errors. None of what I mentioned is intentionally scary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012564517', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1499270597}
review:
From experience I can say that going to the dentist would be highly preferable to playing this game.

Half of the time, this game has rather clunky controls, The other half of the time, you don't have any control.
The help guy is about as useful and pleasant as Clippy.
Sometimes your games disappear, sometimes your programmers just stop working on a project for no apparent reason. (after which they too, will disappear). Obviously with the interest rate the bank charges and the fact that everything disappears, your account balance won't be long for this world either...
And if you ever manage to get lucky and stuff is working, the game will simply crash due to shoddy programming.
And those are the good parts of this game, it only goes downhill from there.

On the bright side, the controls to leave the game are one of the fastest i've seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092999363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1473820198}
review:
You will find pleanty of responses saying why this game is terrible, but if you are looking for something to play with the same theme:

Game Dev Story: This is basicly where this whole genere began. It is not the most complex sim game out there, but is availible for IOS, so it is nice and portable.

Game Dev Tycoon: The quintesetial game dev game. Again, not very complex, but challenging, deep, and very pollished.

Mad Games Tycoon: More complex game about running a game company, highly recomended.

Software Inc.:My favorite of these games, allows you to build a software dev complex while also being throughly engaging.

There, I just gave you four great alternitives, play thoose instead of this trash.

review: Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ. Ğ‘Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸, Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸. Ğ§Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸ÑĞ°ĞµÑ‚. Ğ”ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ³Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞµ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072523974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1494007609}
review:
PREIS bei REVIEW
2,49 â‚¬

VerÃ¶ffentlicht:
2003 und 2006

VERSION
1.5.15

GRAFIK
Im Cartoon-Stil gehalten. VÃ¶llig ausreichend.

SOUND
Hintergrundmusik nichts besonderes, aber auch nicht stÃ¶rend

BALANCE
Zwischen drei Schwierigkeitsgraden wÃ¤hlbar. Leicht ist sehr gut zu meistern, bei Mittel und Schwer ist gutes wirtschaften erforderlich.

ATMOSPHÃ„RE
Etwas zu leblos, kein "Gewusel" auf dem Bildschirm, was allerdings nicht entscheidend ist.

BEDIENUNG
Man bewegt sich mit der Spielfigur in verschiedenen Orten und RÃ¤umen. StÃ¶rt vielleicht den ein oder anderen, mich aber nicht. Per Rechtsklick kommt man immer zurÃ¼ck. Ich habe allgmein keine Probleme mit der Steuerung.

UMFANG
Endlosspiel und 10 Missionen vorhanden, ebenso wie ein Tutorial, welches aber nicht den vollen Umfang des Spiels erklÃ¤rt.

KI
Konkurrenz (nur 2 Mitbewerber) ist vorhanden; Ã¼ber Aktien kÃ¶nnen Anteile gekauft werden.

SPIELSPASS
Bei den Missionen hat man 10 verschiedene Spielzielen (z.B. Entwickle ein Spiel mit 75%-Wertung oder werde MillionÃ¤r). Entsprechend den Missionen sind auch die Startbedingungen unterschiedlich (Startjahr, Startkapital). Egal ob die 10 Missionen oder das Endlosspiel, Ziel ist es natÃ¼rlich mit der Spielentwicklung Geld zu verdienen. Man muss Mitarbeiter (selbstÃ¤ndig oder fest angestellt) einstellen, eventuell Kredite bei der Bank aufnehmen, Lizensen ersteigern, eine Engine beim Notar erwerben oder diese selbst erstellen, Publisher-VertrÃ¤ge kaufen, das Firmenimage steigen, seine Spiele Ã¼ber Marketing pushen, diese selbst produzieren und kann dann im Gameshop die Rangliste anschauen oder am Kiosk den akuellen Trend und die Tests einsehen. Nebenbei darf man sein PrivatvermÃ¶gen in Form neuer MÃ¶bel, etc. steigern. Da Game Tycoon 1.5 eine Wirtschaftssimulation ist sollte man auch dementsprechend seine Entscheidungen gut durchdenken. Beispiel Mitarbeiter: Was es bedeutet einen festangestellten oder frei arbeiteten Mitarbeiter einzustellen sollte man also schon wissen. Wer also den Schwerpunkt gerne auf den wirtschaftlichen Aspekt legt und nicht aus ist schnell ein erfolgreiches Spiel nach dem anderen zu produzieren, ist hier genau richtig. Was nicht heiÃŸt, dass man keine erfolgreichen Spiele produzieren kann. Viele Faktoren hÃ¤ngen davon ab: Welche Mitarbeiter habe ich, welche Engine benutze ich, also wie aktuell ist diese, was lege ich dem Spiel bei der Produktion bei, habe ich eventuell eine Lizens, wie bekannt ist meine Firma usw. Der Aufbau der Spieleentwicklung und viele andere Punkte sind im Gegensatz zum zweiten Teil zwar deutlich schlanker, macht aber dennoch Spass.

BEWERTUNG
69%

FAZIT
Vorweg: Das Spiel wurde im Jahr 2006, also vor GameDevTycoon, GamersGoMakers und MadGamesTycoon verÃ¶ffentlicht. SÃ¤mtliche Vergleiche zu diesen Spielen sind also sowieso nicht mÃ¶glich. Als Vergleich kann man sicher Software Tycoon nennen, allerdings habe ich das selbst nie gespielt, Game Tycoon 1.5 erinnert aber stark daran. Game Tycoon 1.5 ist ja das VorgÃ¤ngerspiel von Game Tycoon 2 und hat somit den Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftssimulation und nicht Casual-Game. Wer hier also schnell man ein paar Spiele entwickeln will um das groÃŸe Geld zu machen, ist bei Game Tycoon vÃ¶llig falsch. Als eine solide Wirtschaftssimulation, bei der man nicht alles auf dem Silbertablett in Form einen Tutorials oder Hilfe bekommt, kann Game Tycoon punkten. Hat man keine Geduld oder keine Lust das Spiel kennen zu lernen, wird man auch nicht erfolgreich spielen kÃ¶nnen. Auf den Punkt gebracht: Ich mache nur Verlust oder meine Spiele bekommen keine gute Wertungen und bin gleich wieder Bankrott heiÃŸt ich mache als Spieler garantiert was falsch. Ist das Spiel jetzt gut? Ja, ist es. Game Tycoon ist eine solide Wirtschaftssimulation, kein Casual-Game-Tycoon, der nur dann Spass macht, wenn man den wirtschaftlichen Aspekt und den Prozess der Spieleentwicklung verstanden hat.

EMPFEHLUNG
Ja, da es derzeit unter 3 â‚¬ zu haben ist.
Ja, wenn man Game Tycoon 2 noch nicht besitzt und dies als Einstieg nutzen will. Es ist folgerichtig dann einfacher Game Tycoon 2 zu verstehen.
Nein, wenn man Game Tycoon 2 schon besitzt und verstanden hat.
Nein, wenn man den Schwerpunkt der Wirtschaftssimulation nicht mag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083523024', 'num_games_owned': 2466, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1488046025}
review:
"The year is 1982" and it plays like it.
I'm exaggerating of course, but even for the 2003's standards (which is when the original version came out. That 2014 release date is just a plain lie, even not counting the original, the 1.5 was released in 2006,) this game is just archaic, on top of being terribly designed, with awful interface that resembles more of a hidden object game rather than a management simulation. Back in the day, there were more Tycoon games that made interfaces in such way, but they were usually better designed, accessible and comprehensible.
Even if you would leave aside the design and aesthetic aspects, this game is still a sloppy work. It's riddled with bugs, crashes constantly and while this one problem was already fixed, they have released this game without its .exe file.
Removing their names and leaving the blank page in the credits is probably the smartest thing they have done in regards to this whole mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074181588', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1520726282}
review:
I came into Game Tycoon 1.5 wanting to like it. The fact that it was originally shipped with no .exe file was a red flag, but I ignored that. How could I not want to try a game I literally got for free? I love these types of games, after all. What if I told you this game has one of the worst, most user-hostile User Interfaces I have EVER used in a game? I'm not being hyperbolic.

Game Tycoon has an interesting history. It was originally phyiscally released in 2006, to the dismay of critics. It was lauded for it's ambitions, but criticized heavily for it's execution. To quote PC Gamer, "If desiging and producing games was really as boring as Game Tycoon makes it, we'd all be playing Zork." A year after Game Dev Tycoon was released and garnered acclaim, Game Tycoon (now with a '1.5' in the title) mysteriously appeared on Steam. Now, I'm not implying that it's trying to rip-off Game Dev Tycoon... I'm just saying that that's incredibly fishy.

When I started up the game, my ears were treated to bland menu music. Nothing memorable, but it's not earbleed worthy. Since I don't typically don't find these games to have engaging soundtracks, I naturally turn off the music through the slider on the menu. I go to start a new game, the window closes, reappears, and the music is playing again. I tried this about 5 times, with the same result each time. I end up shrugging it off and starting the tutorial. The tutorial is vague at best, and operates on a 'theatre of the mind' scheme at worst. During the tutorial, I get lost and nearly think my game is broken. Nope, I just had to drag something into my inventory. The tutorial never mentions you have one and the UI is designed so poorly that I didn't know I had to drag the specified item into my inventory. I move on, finish the tutorial and start a new game.

Immediatley, I'm put into a point-n-click scenario where I need to click from building to building to do such important tasks as: buying a new engine, getting a loan, hiring people, and checking out the newest trends. This sounds interesting in theory, but what this essentially means is that you will spend lots of time going from place to place, doing tasks that could have easily been done in ONE place. It starts out as a nitpick but legit. gets annoying after less than half an hour of gameplay. I think I should also point out the voice acting is really bad from everyone. The music, in some areas, is horrendous and loops! To add insult to injury, there are less than a handful of songs in this game. It's truly bad.

On somewhat of a postive note, the visuals are stylistic, and aren't MS Paint-Nutshack levels of god awful. They still haven't aged well and look like  shit , but they don't look like fucking  shit , so that's a plus. 

The process of getting a game made in this game is confusing, cumbersome and the antithesis of what anyone would consider 'fun'. I honestly can't describe it in full. It's something you have to suffer through to fully understand. Essentially, what it boils down to is going to lots of places to get ready, meddling around in the mind boggling UI, clicking all over the screen with the selected inventory item to get the desired result, and praying that the painkillers will kick in soon. What takes only a few minutes in a competently made tycoon game can take up to 10-20 minutes here, with most of that time being unengaging. Again, I can't exactly describe how poorly executed this is, it's just something that has to be experienced.

Finally, there's the supposed "realism" in this game. This game wants to be realistic, but in it's attempts, the areas that aren't even close to realistic stick out like a sore thumb growing out of an already sore thumb. For one, a 'warehouse' is just a lazzily cobbled together image of a bunch of game cases stacked on top of each other. For another thing, you can apply for a large loan and barely have it hurt you. Also, the printing machine has options that weren't available until decades in the future - something the game is willing to point out, but too lazy to fix. Then, there's the fact that when you start out, there are game magizines full of... nothing. Why would gaming magizines exist if games do not yet exist? In what universe does that octopus logic apply? Why?

Pros:
+An alright art style?

Cons:
-Uninituitive, hostile UI
-Vague (at best) tutorial
-Terrible voice acting
-Terrible music
-Not as realistic as it wants to be
-The main gimmick of the game - making games - is a total slog that's too time consuming for it's own good


Rating:
â˜ Steam REALLY, REALLY needs quality control
â˜‘ Steam really needs quality control
â˜ Bad in general
â˜ Mediocre
â˜ Average
â˜ Above Average
â˜ Competent
â˜ Knacksterpiece

review:
This game is absolutely Garbage with capital G.

If there hadn't been for trading cards i wouldn't have traded this 5H1T even for pennies.

It's not meant for playing since you can't even finish the tutorial - most of the time you don't know what you have to do or where exactly you have to go. In some rooms the noise is so laud that you can't even hear the instructions if you don't step outside. That is if the instructions are correct in the first place.

I give it F for failure.

review:
This game is bad...  It's just not fun to play. The trading cards are nice, and maybe the first 5-10 minutes while you are wandering around in the game can be nice, but overall, I wouldn't recommend this game. 4/10

EDIT: I was being nice. This game sucks. I got it for free, but still lost something. What? My time. My battery life. Don't be even worse and buy this, and I still say the first 5 minutes is ok(but bad), but is a mess afterward. This is terrible. Even worse, the developers made another Game Tycoon (2), and didn't bother working on this garbage heap. I cringe everytime I look at the original review, 4/10?!?! What was I thinking? 1.5/10. <--- Look! 1.5 out of 10! Maybe the developers wanted this game's number to reflect it's ratings.

review:
This game is great if you like collecting or trading cards on steam. 

To get it to run on Windows 10, change compatability mode to Windows XP service pack 2. 

Controls are difficult, nothing is intuitive. I tried to give it a go, but I'm not a fan of headaches so I gave up. Now I have some extra pennies in my steam wallet, thanks Sunlight Games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997801929', 'num_games_owned': 2918, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1477468866}
review:
I would have refunded this if I hadn't got it for free, because it freezes all the time and is a headache to play.  It doesn't work well with Windows 10 or Windows 8.1.  I did not try it on any other systems, but it's a very broken game on those very popular OSs.

The idea behind the game is a sound one.  Tycoon games can be fun.  Game Tycoon is actually designed at least on paper in an interesting way.  Unfortunately, even though the game clearly has a lot of assets created for it (voice acting, 3D character models, etc.), it's not playable.  Not only is it an extremely unstable game but the navigation design is weird and unexplained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055353775', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1474516967}
review: I wanted to like this game, I really did. I enjoyed the first couple of minutes in the tutorial, but then it froze, and I couldn't get it to close. Finally I figured out I had to lock my computer, then hit the escape key to get my lock screen to show. I was then able to force the game to close. Tried again, hit Career, changed the character and the game froze again, and again, and again. This game is actually unplayable no matter how many times I reinstall it. If the developer would bother fixing this issue, then I would love to try it again. Got it for free through Indie Gala, and it wasn't worth the time it took to redeem it.

review: I got this game for free and I feel like I got ripped off. The game hard crashes my computer. I couldn't get past the menu. From what I saw of the menu, the assets looked half-assed, unintuitive, and amateur. I would hate myself if I had spent money on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965747376', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1470882197}
review: Go play Game Dev Tycoon. The tutorial is really difficult, voice is hard to hear and there is no indication to where you have to go. Worst is you have to go some somewhere : You have a map for different section of the town and you insta-go to those sections, then you have to walk between buildings, while clock is in expresso, for the service you need... but why is my office in a seperate building from the development team? Once inside, you have a disorganized room you aren't certain what you can or cannot click. It is a confusing blob. I can overlook th graphics which feels nostagic to Bullfrog's Theme Hospital.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060413623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1471367465}
review:
#First ENG/potem Polski
To be honest, game isn't worth this 2,5 euros. Completely bugged, first bug i found just 2 minutes after start.
Lots, lots of bugs.  For example - there was a time my PDA showed "You don't have money for"
Yup, i didn't have money for. For what ? Yeah, that's a good question.
Poor graphics, annoying tutorial. 
Completely catastrophic game design, fonts are unreadable and annoying for eyes to see.
Most of the objects not-interacting. I can't believe this game was published in 2014, not 1982.
Could not recommend, cannot recommend, and will not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103012374', 'num_games_owned': 1420, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1471204388}
review:
VERSIÃ“N SIMPLIFICADA:
Â¿En serio estÃ¡s pensando en gastarte 2.49â‚¬ en esta aberraciÃ³n? Se me ocurre algo mejor, cierra Steam ahora mismo, tÃºmbate en la cama y reflexiona. Eso o Ã©chale un ojo a las ofertas semanales de Steam donde, si buscas un poco, encuentras cosas mucho mejores por menos dinero. Esta semana estÃ¡ Terrorhedron por 0.24â‚¬, Super Trench Attack por 0.49â‚¬ y Plantera por 1.73â‚¬ (2.46â‚¬ en total). Aunque siempre puedes comprar este juego y, a la media hora, volver aquÃ­ y darme la razÃ³n, pero ya serÃ¡ demasiado tarde. Es tÃº decisiÃ³n.

VERSIÃ“N AMPLIADA:
Me gustarÃ­a empezar diciendo que esto no es Game Dev Tycoon. Repito, no es Game Dev Tycoon.

Supongo que, en parte, pretenderÃ­a ser algo similar pero con mÃ¡s opciones. Pero, sinceramente, no se aproxima en absoluto a la joyita de Greenheart Games.
Me atreverÃ­a a decir que en la sencillez de dicho juego reside su abrumador Ã©xito (al menos en cuanto a crÃ­tica). Pero es que en este juego creo que han pecado de querer introducir demasiadas cosas y les ha acabado pasando factura.

AsÃ­ que sin mÃ¡s comparaciones, paso a describir mi experiencia con este juego (o lo que quiera que sea esto):
- Al jugarlo en pantalla completa, mi monitor se ha vuelto loco hasta que me ha saltado un error y ha crasheado el juego. Vamos, lo que es empezar con buen pie.
- El tutorial. Madre mÃ­a, tienes un tÃ­o hablando y explicÃ¡ndote lo que tienes que hacer. Sin textos, solo con sonido. En inglÃ©s. Si lo entiendes, bien, si no lo haces te lo repetirÃ¡ una y otra vez hasta que, por casualidad, aciertes. Creo que haberlo hecho todo con textos en vez de con voces hubiera sido una decisiÃ³n mejor.
- El personaje. Manejamos a un muÃ±eco que se mueve de una forma muy rara, con unas animaciones horribles. Tienes que ir moviÃ©ndote por un mapa de 4 localizaciones para pedir prÃ©stamos, contratar gente, crear copias de tus juegos, etc. La idea estÃ¡ bien, pero se podrÃ­an haber ahorrado lo de ir moviendo al muÃ±eco. Con poner un menÃº con los lugares y punto habrÃ­a sido suficiente.
- La dificultad. El punto anterior lo hace todo demasiado complicado (en cuanto a tiempo a invertir, al menos). Pedir dinero al banco, crear un motor grÃ¡fico, contratar gente, escoger un contrato, crear el juego, crear copias, y hasta ahÃ­ he sido capaz de llegar. Lo sÃ©, todo esto habÃ­a que hacerlo en el anteriormente mencionado Game Dev Tycoon, pero era tan fÃ¡cil y rÃ¡pido que en menos de un minuto estabas creando el juego. Y entiendo la intenciÃ³n de darle ese realismo de creador de videojuegos novato (sobre todo con lo de crear las copias a mano), pero la ejecuciÃ³n es realmente desastrosa.

En conclusiÃ³n, una idea para nada mala ejecutada de la peor manera posible. Viendo las crÃ­ticas de Game Tycoon 2 parece que han mejorado algo, aunque no sÃ© si lo suficiente.

No merece la pena pagar por Ã©l, ni tampoco merece la pena obteniendo una key de manera gratuÃ­ta. Pero al menos tiene cromos, factor importante para una gran parte de los jugadores de Steam, asÃ­ que tocarÃ¡ dejarlo en segundo plano hasta que obtenga dichos cromos. Luego, lo desintalarÃ© y borrarÃ© el juego de mi cuenta. O algo asÃ­.

review:
This game started of not that bad but that didn't last long Oh no it lasted for 5 minutes.
This game got worse and worse overtime as i gave it a chance to redeem it self it gave me:

- A blue screen after forcing it to exit 

Even free is to much for this piece of trash.

review: Tato hra je moc zabugovanÃ¡, nebo se furt sekne a musÃ­m kvÅ¯li tomu vypnout celÃ½ PC.Pro mÄ› je hra nehratelnÃ¡, takÅ¾e jÃ­ nedoporuÄuju .

author: {'steamid': '76561198088607678', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1470756633}
review:
Worst possible tutorial I have ever seen.
I loved Game Dev Tycoon and thought that this will be similar to it but wow..

The tutorial tells you to pick a publishing deal from the given choices.. I picked one. Finished making the game and was sent to packing and to the production of copies. Finished those and then was told to add the publishing deal.

Guess what.. Was told the game is not good enough for the publishing deal.. How can a game be not good enough before it was released and given a rating?? How the hell do you give publishing deals in the tutorial and don't even explain anything about them? Or even explain how to get rating for the game.

Sorry, total crap. At least it gives cards.

review:

review: DO NOT BELIEVE WHAT EVERYONE ELSE IS SAYING. This game is a bloody masterpiece, it just takes the proper skill and knowledge to properly play it. There are proper real life mechanics which are fun as well as true to the real life process of making games. I personally have less than half an hour of experience with this game, showing that this is a captivating game that really draws you in and makes you beg for more. This is one of the games which will definitely be up there for GOTY. winkyface

review: This game is hurendous. I have trying to give it a chance time and time again but it keeps being a pain in the head. You really have to play the tutorial first but even that is messed up. Its not a good game, both stylish and simulation wise. Then the game crashes unexpectedly. There are good business simulation games out there and why this game is going so far off I can see what they tried to do, but failed so hard that the sequel must be better right. But don't buy this game and do not buy athe seqiel or any game from this developer cause they are not doing good games... playable games unfortunately. I am on the bring to ask for my money back at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069800300', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1457738577}
review:
[h1]Game Review: Game Tycoon 1.5[/h1]

[u]Worum geht es in Game Tycoon 1.5?[/u]
Ich denke es geht darum, dass man seine eigenen Spiele entwickelt. Dies tut man indem man sie programmiert und dann durch die Stadt(?) rennt und dann da Grafiken macht und dort prouziert und irgendwo verkauft.

[u]Positive Aspekte[/u]
Die allgemeine Idee vom Spiel ist nett.

[u]Negative Aspekte[/u]
Es ist alt und so sieht es auch aus. Es ist unmenschlich zu spielen. Entweder bin ich zu kacke oder was weiÃŸ ich, aber ich habe nie ein Spiel verkauft (:c).

[u]Fazit[/u]
Ich mag es nicht und empfehlen tue ich es auch niemanden. Es macht einfach keinen SpaÃŸ, trotz der eigentlichen guten Idee.

review:
I wasnt expecting much from a 0.65$ game, but at least i was expecting a working one.
Once in game, i created my company and then entered the bank for a loan. everything worked well except the part where i tried to leave the bank. the only way is to hit escape wich bring you back to thye company creation menu.
Basically this is an unfinished game that is being sold to you by lazy people who never took time to finish it.
Do not buy. for your own wallet's sake.

review: Best experience of a game I've ever had. Greatest game. Would reccomend it to people who love games that give you absolutely no background whatsoever; and games that just crash out of nowhere. This game is also very innovative and different. Instead of telling you what to do, it throws your character into a town where you have absolutely no idea what you're doing. I am one of those people.  Would also erectomend it to peopelo who love sexy graphics. They are so smooth for 1982.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071705305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1448890600}
review:
Horrible horrible game. DO NOT BUY! If someone wants to give it to you tell them to f-off!

You can't skip the tutorial and make sure that when you do what the tutorial asks you to do you don't take to long because the tutorial guy will pop-up and repeat the same sentence over and over again. And if you try to do something outside the tutorial the game crashes (at least mine did).

So would I recommend it? Yes to my enemies, or to someone who wants to throw their computer through their window... 

What would i recommend instead of buying this piece of crap? Take your money and use it as toiletpaper then it will have done you better than this game ever will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116551454', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1445832139}
review:
Didn't play too much because such a weird game. Also this isn't some continueation...just  a really bad spinoff.

Pros:
Creative UI and layout of all funtions
You can make your own game engine an games
Creative Hub world

Negatives:
Graphics(Looks like something a PS1 could run)
Confusing mechanics(Game making and stuff)
Horrible repetitive music
Horrible dialogue

Honestly thats all I got out of in under 5 minutes!

Although I did like the idea just not for me.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995051622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1445320643}
review:
I usually try to get past the tutorial before I rage quit, but I literally couldn't. It doesn't state how to turn pages in a magazine, it doesn't tell you which buildings are which, you just have to go to each one and randomly click stuff, it doesn't tell you all that much of anything. But what was the most annoying was the guy kept repeating himself and sometimes his speach was either not understandable or you couldn't hear him for the background noise. He'd pop up everytime I was trying to read the stats of the contracts. And who the hell pays just to READ a magazine?! Why wouldn't you get to keep that magazine. I ended up spending about 20 bucks on one stupid magazine that I couldn't even turn the pages in!
I am glad I bought this on sell, because it's not worth full price. I'm not the type to ask for 29 cents back, but still I wish they'd put these games as demos if they're going to suck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025005854', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1434736375}
review:
Game Tycoon 1.5 is a rerelease of Game Tycoon, a game-building simulator published and widely-criticized in 2006. While Sunlight Games certainly had the opportunity to capitalize on the growth of interest in the genre in more recent years and fix the game, playing Game Tycoon 1.5 is a frustrating experience and one has to wonder why Sunlight Games did not simply start from scratch.

The visual aspects of the game fluctuate between "passable for a low-budget PC game developed a decade ago" and downright laughable. In some parts of the game, text is pre-rendered as graphics. In other parts of the game, text consists of blue Times New Roman on a white screen. Think hyperlinks on the most basic webpages out of the early 2000s. The music is similar; some is passable, but some borders on the absurd. One track of the game is a six-second loop, but it doesn't loop properly. There is a delay between each loop, breaking any possible sense of immersion. It's like a bad Vine.

The functionality is, of course, entirely broken. A tooltip will demand that you name your engine even after a name is provided. Buttons and boxes will not work, and progressing in the game requires a lot of rebooting, backing out of menu and, perhaps for some, copious amounts of praying. Easily, however, the worst aspect of this game is its ridiculous mechanics. There are many different actions that the player may take to fund or advertise their game, develop it, recruit staff and so on, more, than one might even expect from a low-budget game. Unfortunately, most time spent in this game will consist of your character walking between the advertising agencies, the university, the bank and so on because yes, that is how this game is played. You do not navigate menus, you walk slowly in a psuedo-3D world in order to get to where you need to go. It is tedious and, miraculously, it manages to be worse than any escort mission because it serves zero purpose.

I know of four games in the game-building genre and this, as a game that isn't even in early access, is by far the worst. Your other options include Game Dev Tycoon and Mad Games Tycoon on the PC and Game Dev Story (personal favorite) on mobile devices. All of these games look, sound and play better than Game Tycoon 1.5, and you would be far better off to save yourself from the circle of hell that is Game Tycoon 1.5. Even if you get it in a bundle, donâ€™t bother. It lacks any redeeming quality and ought to have been forgotten a decade ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040434239', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1392743536}
review:
STAY AWAY!!!
This is a game about making other games. The same concept as Game Dev Tycoon. Before I go on I just want to say that you should get that game instead as it does a MUCH better job.

Cons:
- Extremely slow gameplay.
- Quite buggy.
- Tutorial isn't informative enough.
- The game is really hard to learn without a proper tutorial.
- At launch the .exe file wasn't there so the game wouldn't launch (says a little about the game quality as well as Steam's quality checks).
- No proper options-screen (although your computer should be able to run it considering the horrible graphics).
- Not sure about this one, but I'm pretty sure it's just an old game that's been put up on Steam. I think I read that some places.

Now to the pros:
- There are none

So please, don't buy this horrible game. Not even it's on 99% sale. You will regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969333093', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1425993046}
review:
This game has it's issues.  In full-screen mode, whenever you change windows, the game blinks to the desktop to show you a loading bar, then goes back into the game with the new menu.  There is no useful information in the game, tutorial or otherwise, to get you started.  The audio always works fine, but sometimes the voices seem to work, while other times they don't.  However, if you take the time to watch someone who has learned this game play it on Youtube, I think you will enjoy this game for a while.

I watched someone else play, was reminded instantly of MAD TV (an old German DOS game where you run a television station in a similar fashion), then bought the game in a bundle.  It is similar to MAD TV in a few ways.  You run your character around various places to draft ideas for games, hire workers (programmers, artists, composers), buy engines until you can afford to make your own, produce the game, then get a publishing contract, and finally ship the game to stores.  There's even a store you can enter to check the top 10 selling video games, until your game stops making money, where you then can try to sell it or throw it away.  There's an auction to get license for real movies and other popular brands (I had a spoof of Indiana Jones that sold well, but also cost me a lot).  There is enough going on in this game at any given point to where you get in this loop of design, produce, sell, and it might take you a restart or two, but with a little trial and error, you can be successful.

Overall, this game is definitely a lower budget title, and it shows.  I would've liked to see a bit more, such as gaming conventions like in Game Dev Tycoon, or even awards that your game could win from reviewers.  But like MAD TV, once you learn the ropes of the game, and finally avoid going bankrupt on your budgets, it's a pretty solid simulator.  Nothing special, but it's definitely entertaining for a couple of hours at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970406460', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1426961453}

review:
Game freezes so often. mostly after when developping several games then entering into some buildings. 
as others saying, there are too many cons which make me feel like meaningless as to playability.
but before them, devs should refine this game to be playable on today's OS and machine.
though save game became work with newest update at least, the freezing in critical time really irritates me.

but there is very fun elements which other similer game doesn't focus on. game engine, ads, publisher and employment. every one of choice is fatal and might cause a player to ruin from the beginning.

i cant recommend this game for basic problem of freezing, but i have a fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076868148', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1422793049}
review:
[h1]Gameplay Premise[/h1]
The premise of the gameplay is simple. To be the best game tycoon. This is a simulator game, so some semblance to the facts are expected.

[h1]Tutorial[/h1]
The tutorial is spoken, there is no subtitle, and there is no explanation on what should be done. For example : You are told to borrow $100k from the bank, but you are not told where the bank is and how to even sign the paper. You are told to manage your developer, and you are not told where is your developer office (turns out, the development office is separate from your personal office). In short, the tutorial is not helpful at all.

[h1]The UI[/h1]
The UI is very bad. There is no tooltips at all. If you hover over something, there won't be any explanation. As UI is related to how information is given out to you, this game is also very bad at that. To access your game quality, you have to go to a certain object. To access your sales number, you have to click on some paper on your table. To access your financial report, you have to click on another paper on your table. There is no collated financial reports, no collated engine/game reports. Some reports have to be accessed outside your personal office, which you must travel to other place just to get a piece of report.

The notion of personal office looks like Airline Tycoon Deluxe, which are a great game. In Airline Tycoon, there are tooltips so that we know what we are going to click. To access the incoming message, just click on the paper organizer in your office. To access your plane facilities, click on the plane model. To access the fuel price and setting, click on the fuel painting on the wall. To access your route, click on the globe. To access your financial report, just a click away. This is very different with Game Tycoon 1.5.

Game Tycoon 1.5 fails to present the information needed with a good manner, information is fragmented. For tycoon games failure to present information is very bad, as those information are the key to success in these kind of games.

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]
The gameplay is horrid. 

[b]There are no clear explanation.[/b]
What is the differences between Keyboard controller and Joystick? Japanese language and English language? No explanation at all. 

[b]The game is too complex.[/b]
Not complex in a good manner. To build a game, you have to create an engine. During the creation of engine, you have to enter the features (like Game Dev Tycoon) though it's unclear which features is better than the others. During the creation of engine you are also able to set how many developers are going to develop the engine. Next, you have to print it and it is stored at your inventory. After that, you have to go to the university, and grab some developers.

After that, you have to go to the developers office (beside your office, they have darts targeting your character) and assign programmers to the project. No problem on this part.
After that, you develop the game, same thing, you have the game "cassette" on your inventory. Then, you have to go to design factory to define how much gimmicks you wanted. Then you go to factory to print out your product. Then to licensing to find a publisher. Then to factory again to sell the game.

The process is believable, but presented in such clunky manner that you will be confused in no time. While a good game will present all of those above steps in a UI that have drop-down menus, this game is not. As outlined above, because information is too fragmented. For example : After printing out your product, you go to publisher. The publisher demands your game have a specific rating. If you have printed your game, you can't know the rating anymore, the rating is known only after the game is developed. These kind of thing is very bad, information should be able to be accessed at all times!

[b]No feedback[/b]
While the Game Dev Tycoon provides feedback to the player by giving out review scores, this game did not give any. Review scores are important to give us facts how good is our product. But no dice, no feedback, no nothing. In tycoon games it is important to have feedback. For example, if we are told that our sales drop in such areas, we should know the cause. Bad product? Bad pricing? Bad sales? We must have information. This game lacks those, so the players could not make informed decisions to make something.

[b]Bad Game Structure[/b]
No menus. Simply horrid. You can't access functions inside the game, you have to go out to main menu to get that. You can't go to settings, you have to go to main menu to access settings. Not to mention that the game will drop to desktop for a few second if you go to main menu. That is simply unacceptable.

[h1]Look and Feel[/h1]
Simply lacking. The game has some quality in drawing, but very lacking in other aspects. The music is bad. 
 
[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
I got this game from a bundle, so it is not a bad loss to me.
STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME.
I think this game is the Big Rigs of tycoon genre.
